ThingDef.label: adventure dress
ThingDef.description: These sturdy dresses are made for active ladies who are looking for adventure and exploring new lands.

ThingDef.label: elegant dress
ThingDef.description: This dress is gorgeous and graceful.

ThingDef.label: maid dress(A)
ThingDef.description: These are the clothes that maids wear. A skilled maid is skilled not only in housekeeping but also in handling a gun.

ThingDef.label: maid dress(B)
ThingDef.description: These are the clothes that maids wear. A skilled maid is skilled not only in housekeeping but also in handling a gun.

ThingDef.label: walking dress
ThingDef.description: These dresses are intended to be worn outdoors. Now and then, fashionable women seem eager to incorporate trendy styles and colors.

ThingDef.label: riding habit dress
ThingDef.description: This dress is worn for horseback riding. Even though it is a dress, the figure is very dignified.

ThingDef.label: simple dress
ThingDef.description: The dress is not flashy and has a relaxed atmosphere.

ThingDef.label: dress coat
ThingDef.description: This coat is worn over a dress. It is warm because it is made of a lot of fur.
This is a daytime formal attire for men used from the mid-19th century to the early 20th century.
ThingDef.label: frock coat

ThingDef.description: This attire is designed for smoking cigarettes. It was the prototype for the later tuxedo.
ThingDef.label: smoking jacket

ThingDef.description: This is what is called a "vest". It has no sleeves and is mainly worn under a suit jacket.
ThingDef.label: waistcoat

ThingDef.description: This westcoat incorporates a metal plate. It is not a luxury to protect yourself as much as possible. Walking speed is slightly slower.
ThingDef.label: bulletproof waistcoat

ThingDef.description: It is a uniform worn by military personnel. It inspires the heart of the wearer.
ThingDef.label: soldier coat

ThingDef.description: It is the jacket of the honored cavalryman. It inspires the heart of the wearer.
ThingDef.label: hussar jacket
feathered hat
ThingDef.description: This stylish hat is decorated with feathers.

ThingDef.label: maid headdress(A)
ThingDef.description: Maid's headdress. It is for cleanliness and does not protect the head.

ThingDef.label: maid headdress(B)
ThingDef.description: Maid's headdress. It is for cleanliness and does not protect the head.

ThingDef.label: boater Hat
ThingDef.description: These hats are woven primarily from dried plant fibers. Some are made of fabric or leather.

ThingDef.label: top hat
ThingDef.description: A cylindrical hat with both sides of the brim turned up.No doves appear.

ThingDef.label: soldier helmet
ThingDef.description: This is a helmet worn by soldiers. Since it is made of cloth or leather, not metal, there are concerns about its defensiveness.

ThingDef.label: slouch hat
ThingDef.description: It is a wide-brimmed cloth hat. It was mainly worn by soldiers.

ThingDef.label: shako hat
ThingDef.description: It is a high cylindrical hat with a large metal insignia on the front.

ThingDef.label: metal soldier helmet
ThingDef.description: A soldier's helmet made of metal. It is not only brave, but also offers good protection.

ThingDef.label: glasses
ThingDef.description: These glasses are round and fashionable. They look smart.

ThingDef.label: monocle
ThingDef.description: It is a round and stylish monocle. They look smart.

ThingDef.label: VacSlipsuit
ThingDef.description: A high-tech, skin-tight suit which offers some of the best protection from harsh environments available for gravship crews, special forces, explorers and scientists. It acts like a sort of second skin for the wearer. It monitors and regulates the body to keep it in working shape. It also comes with an invisible, thin vac-barrier hood for the head.

ThingDef.label: child VacSlipsuit
ThingDef.description: A high-tech, skin-tight suit which offers some of the best protection from harsh environments available for gravship crews, special forces, explorers and scientists. It acts like a sort of second skin for the wearer. It monitors and regulates the body to keep it in working shape. It also comes with an invisible, thin vac-barrier hood for the head. This one's for kids.

ThingDef.label: prison jumpsuit
ThingDef.description: An orange jumpsuit worn by prisoners.

ThingDef.label: prestige vacsuit helmet
ThingDef.description: A helmet that efficiently recycles the user's oxygen, allowing them to breathe in the vacuum of space for hours at a time. The process isn't perfectly efficient, so the user must periodically return to a pressurized environment.\n\nExpensive and beautiful, prestige armor like this is usually made for those of high status. Embedded eltex threads also enhance the wearer's psychic sensitivity.

ThingDef.label: prestige vacsuit
ThingDef.description: A protective suit that keeps the user safe in the vacuum of space. The suit restricts the wearer's movement, considerably reducing their movement speed. \n\nExpensive and beautiful, prestige armor like this is usually made for those of high status. Embedded eltex threads also enhance the wearer's psychic sensitivity.

ThingDef.label: odysseus vacsuit helmet
ThingDef.description: A helmet that efficiently recycles the user's oxygen, allowing them to breathe in the vacuum of space for hours at a time. The process isn't perfectly efficient, so the user must periodically return to a pressurized environment. This more rugged and advanced vacsuit strikes a balance between armor and agility which makes it a perfect middle ground between vacsuits and power armors and as such is favoured by independent explorer crews.

ThingDef.label: odysseus vacsuit
ThingDef.description: A protective suit that keeps the user safe in the vacuum of space. The suit restricts the wearer's movement, considerably reducing their movement speed. This more rugged and advanced vacsuit strikes a balance between armor and agility which makes it a perfect middle ground between vacsuits and power armors and as such is favoured by independent explorer crews.

ThingDef.label: nomad technopath hood
ThingDef.description: Those who believe the Archotechs to be divine often make their way to the most barren landscapes in search of lost technology, artifacts, and the coveted digital-psychic soul transfiguration.\nThis adornment is worn by self proclaimed high prophets of the Archotechs. Having enough good fortune to scrounge together the materials for such a hood amongst the wastes is often seen as a sign that the technopath is favored by the machines gods.

ThingDef.label: nomad caravan guard helmet
ThingDef.description: Those who believe the Archotechs to be divine often make their way to the most barren landscapes in search of lost technology, artifacts, and the coveted digital-psychic soul transfiguration.\nThe ingenuity of the techno-pilgrims is on full display in the helmet of a caravan guard. Forged together from scrap to withstand a fight in the most hostile conditions imaginable while being simple to service. The light at the center of the helmet gives courage to the guards, viewed as an anointment, it reinforces their faith in their holy mission.

ThingDef.label: nomad hood
ThingDef.description: Those who believe the Archotechs to be divine often make their way to the most barren landscapes in search of lost technology, artifacts, and the coveted digital-psychic soul transfiguration.\nThis mask was designed to keep dust, snow, and polluted particles out of the wearers lungs and eyes while being easy to maintain for extended periods of time. To many, glowing eyes in the storm have become an enduring symbol of their faith in the machine.

ThingDef.label: nomad technopath robe
ThingDef.description: Those who believe the Archotechs to be divine often make their way to the most barren landscapes in search of lost technology, artifacts, and the coveted digital-psychic soul transfiguration.\nDecorated with pieces of humming archotechnology shards, this raiment is worn by the prophets and technopaths who have some link to the Archotechs. Technopaths wear this robe as they lead their flock of machine-worshippers into the wastes in search of revelations and devices from ages long forgotten.

ThingDef.label: nomad caravan guard cloak
ThingDef.description: Those who believe the Archotechs to be divine often make their way to the most barren landscapes in search of lost technology, artifacts, and the coveted digital-psychic soul transfiguration.\nThis cloak keeps the wearer safe from the environment and those who would raid the caravan to loot the valuable lost-tech artifacts the seekers view as holy. Those who wear this stand proudly at the flanks of their traveling column, vigilant across blizzards and dunes alike.

ThingDef.label: nomad rags
ThingDef.description: Those who believe the Archotechs to be divine often make their way to the most barren landscapes in search of lost technology, artifacts, and the coveted digital-psychic soul transfiguration.\nThese hardy rags are worn by the pilgrims who seek to brave even radioactive wastes for signs of their gods.

ThingDef.label: nomadwear
ThingDef.description: Those who believe the Archotechs to be divine often make their way to the most barren landscapes in search of lost technology, artifacts, and the coveted digital-psychic soul transfiguration.\nA bodysuit and waist cape that is the result of years of ingenuity, practical engineering, and scavenging ancient technology. Often worn by the survivors of a forgotten apocalypse who came to view their lost tech as divine, or entire tribes on harsh worlds who left everything behind to seek communion with the Archotechs. These signature clothes of nomads and seekers alike are rather simple to produce despite the relative sophistication of its technology.

ThingDef.label: Byzantine Imperial Crown
ThingDef.description: A crown of metal with an elaborate design, truly worthy of a successor to Rome!

ThingDef.label: Byzantine Imperial Crown (Stuffable)
ThingDef.description: A crown of metal with an elaborate design, truly worthy of a successor to Rome!

ThingDef.label: Emerald Crown
ThingDef.description: A crown of metal with an elaborate design, truly worthy of a successor to Rome!

ThingDef.description: A crown of metal with an elaborate design, truly worthy of a successor to Rome!

ThingDef.label: Holy Roman Reichskrone
ThingDef.description: A crown of metal with an extremely elaborate design.

ThingDef.label: Holy Roman Reichskrone (Stuffable)
ThingDef.description: A crown of metal with an extremely elaborate design.

ThingDef.label: gravship captain vacsuit
ThingDef.description: A protective suit that keeps the user safe in the vacuum of space. The suit restricts the wearer's movement, considerably reducing their movement speed. The coat worn over this vacsuit is often recognised as a universal status symbol of high-ranking officers or captains among gravship crews.

ThingDef.label: prestige gravship captain vacsuit
ThingDef.description: A protective suit that keeps the user safe in the vacuum of space. The suit restricts the wearer's movement, considerably reducing their movement speed. The coat worn over this vacsuit is often recognised as a universal status symbol of high-ranking officers or captains among imperial gravship crews. \n\nExpensive and beautiful, prestige armor like this is usually made for those of high status. Embedded eltex threads also enhance the wearer's psychic sensitivity.

ThingDef.label: gravship captain helmet
ThingDef.description: A helmet that efficiently recycles the user's oxygen, allowing them to breathe in the vacuum of space for hours at a time. The process isn't perfectly efficient, so the user must periodically return to a pressurized environment. This helmet has been adorned with a hat often worn by gravship captains.

ThingDef.label: prestige gravship captain helmet
ThingDef.description: A helmet that efficiently recycles the user's oxygen, allowing them to breathe in the vacuum of space for hours at a time. The process isn't perfectly efficient, so the user must periodically return to a pressurized environment. This helmet has been adorned with a hat often worn by imperial gravship captains.\n\nExpensive and beautiful, prestige armor like this is usually made for those of high status. Embedded eltex threads also enhance the wearer's psychic sensitivity.
A cyberpunk uniform worn by police officers.
ThingDef.label: police uniform

ThingDef.description: A cyberpunk armored vest worn by police officers.
ThingDef.label: police vest
police hat
ThingDef.description: A cyberpunk peaked cap worn by police officers.

ThingDef.label: MaxTac helmet
ThingDef.description: A cyberpunk armored helmet worn by MaxTac officers.

ThingDef.label: head bandana
ThingDef.description: A kerchief (from the Old French couvrechief, "cover head"), also known as a bandana or bandanna, is a triangular or square piece of cloth tied around the head, face or neck for protective or decorative purposes.

ThingDef.label: face bandana
ThingDef.description: A kerchief (from the Old French couvrechief, "cover head"), also known as a bandana or bandanna, is a triangular or square piece of cloth tied around the head, face or neck for protective or decorative purposes.

ThingDef.label: head scarf
ThingDef.description: The keffiyeh or kufiya (Arabic: kfyah, meaning "relating to Kufa") also known as a ghutrah (), shemagh ( um), aah () or mashadah (), is a traditional Arabian headdress, or what is sometimes called a habit, which originated in Yemen; it is now worn throughout the Middle East region. In Iran it is known as a chafiyeh ().

Webbing is a strong fabric woven as a flat strip or tube of varying width and fibres, often used in place of rope. It is a versatile component used in climbing, slacklining, furniture manufacturing, automobile safety, auto racing, towing, parachuting, military apparel, load securing, and many other fields.\n\nThis variant is an M56 webbing configured to the style of the Vietnam war era.
ThingDef.label: M56 webbing

ThingDef.description: A tough tactical jacket to stop scrapes and bruises, designed for use in the field. It is able to keep one warm in chilly weather, also has armpit zips to cool off in the heat unlike other traditional jackets.\n\nThis brand of tactical jacket is of the TACVASEN series.
ThingDef.label: softshell jacket

ThingDef.description: A tough sweatshirt with a hood to stop scrapes and bruises. It is able to keep one warm in chilly weather.\n\nThis brand of tactical jacket is of the Fruit Of The Loom series.
ThingDef.label: hoodie jacket

ThingDef.description: Norweigan shirt or "Norgi" top is a very popular cold weather shirt due to its extreme warmth and reliability. It has been widely used as a standard issue wet and warm kit by the military.
ThingDef.label: Norweigan shirt

ThingDef.description: A polo shirt is a form of shirt with a collar, a placket neckline with two or three buttons, and an optional pocket. \n\nThis brand of polo shirts is of the 5.11 tactical series.
ThingDef.label: polo shirt

ThingDef.description: The rapid assault shirt is a form of shirt designed to be worn under body armour for hot conditions, a breathable and quick dry layer for the torso and arm sleeves with pockets and velcro patches. \n\nThis brand of Under Body Armor Clothing is of the Crye Gen-2 series.
ThingDef.label: Crye G2 uniform

ThingDef.description: The rapid assault shirt is a form of shirt designed to be worn under body armour for hot conditions, a breathable and quick dry layer for the torso and arm sleeves with pockets and velcro patches. \n\nThis brand of rapid assault shirts is of the 5.11 tactical series.
ThingDef.label: rapid assault shirt

ThingDef.description: Gorka 3 Suit Bars is a Russian special forces military uniform suit designed for mountain divisions (the word "Gorka" originates from Russian word "mountain"). This BDU first appeared in the Soviet army during the Afghanistan war, then widely use during Chechen wars and other conflicts. It is mainly used by special forces (spetsnaz) of MVD, FSB, VDV (airborne), GRU.
ThingDef.label: GORKA 3 jacket

ThingDef.description: A combat shirt is a flame resistant shirt with collars designed to be worn under body armour or as a type of uniform. \n\nThis brand of combat shirts is of the BLACKHAWK! pursuit shirt series.
ThingDef.label: pursuit shirt

ThingDef.description: A flight suit is a full-body garment, worn while flying aircraft such as military airplanes, gliders and helicopters. These suits are generally made to keep the wearer warm, as well as being practical (plenty of pockets), and durable (including fire retardant). Its appearance is usually similar to a jumpsuit. A military flight suit may also show rank insignia. It is sometimes used as a combat uniform in close quarters battle or visit, board, search, and seizure situations, for its practicality. \n\nThis brand of flight suit is of the Brandit series.
ThingDef.label: flight suit

ThingDef.description: A sleeveless shirt is a shirt manufactured without sleeves, or whose sleeves have been cut off. Depending on the style, they can be worn as undershirts, worn by athletes in sports such as track and field and triathlon, or as casual wear.
ThingDef.label: tank top

ThingDef.description: A dress shirt, button shirt, button-front, button-front shirt, or button-up shirt is a garment with a collar and a full-length opening at the front, which is fastened using buttons or shirt studs. A button-down or button-down shirt is a dress shirt which has a button-down collar a collar having the ends fastened to the shirt with buttons.\n\nA dress shirt is normally made from woven cloth, and is often accompanied by a tie, jacket, suit, or formalwear, but a dress shirt may also be worn more casually.
ThingDef.label: button shirt

ThingDef.description: The aloha shirt, also referred to as a Hawaiian shirt, is a style of dress shirt originating in Hawaii. They are collared and buttoned dress shirts, usually short-sleeved and made from printed fabric. They are often worn untucked, but can also be worn tucked into the waist of trousers. They are worn casually or as informal business attire in Hawaii.
ThingDef.label: Hawaiian shirt

ThingDef.description: Designer clothing is expensive luxury clothing considered to be high quality and haute couture for the general public, made by, or carrying the label of, a well-known fashion designer.
ThingDef.label: designer shirt

ThingDef.description: A combat uniform, field uniform, or battledress, is a type of uniform used in combat, as opposed to dress uniforms worn in functions and parades. In American English, the term fatigues is often used, originally being a term for soldiers' work uniforms. The combat uniform is generally camouflaged, either in monochrome such as a shade of green or brown to approximate the background, or in a disruptive pattern.\n\nThis version of uniform is a Universal Camo Pattern (UCP) Army Combat Uniform (ACU).
ThingDef.label: ACU (UCP)

ThingDef.description: A combat uniform, field uniform, or battledress, is a type of uniform used in combat, as opposed to dress uniforms worn in functions and parades. In American English, the term fatigues is often used, originally being a term for soldiers' work uniforms. The combat uniform is generally camouflaged, either in monochrome such as a shade of green or brown to approximate the background, or in a disruptive pattern.\n\nThis version of uniform is a Desert Marine Pattern (MARPAT) Battle Dress Uniform (BDU).
ThingDef.label: BDU (D MARPAT)

ThingDef.description: A combat uniform, field uniform, or battledress, is a type of uniform used in combat, as opposed to dress uniforms worn in functions and parades. In American English, the term fatigues is often used, originally being a term for soldiers' work uniforms. The combat uniform is generally camouflaged, either in monochrome such as a shade of green or brown to approximate the background, or in a disruptive pattern.\n\nThis version of uniform is an Under Body Armor Clothing (UBAC) in Desert Disruptive Pattern Material (DPM)
ThingDef.label: UBAC (D DPM)
ear defenders (PELTOR Optime II)
ThingDef.description: The PELTOR Optime II ear defender. Ear Defenders are used to reduce loud volumes that may be damaging to one's hearing. Hearing defenders can supress 10% of psychic sensitivity.

ThingDef.label: sunglasses (Ray-Bans Aviator)
ThingDef.description: Eye protection is protective gear for the eyes, and sometimes face, designed to reduce the risk of injury. Examples of risks requiring eye protection can include: impact from particles or debris, light or radiation, wind blast, heat, sea spray or impact from some type of ball or puck used in sports.\n\nThis brand of eyewear comes from the Ray-Bans "RB3025" Aviator sunglasses series.

ThingDef.label: sunglasses (Ray-Bans PREDATOR 2)
ThingDef.description: Eye protection is protective gear for the eyes, and sometimes face, designed to reduce the risk of injury. Examples of risks requiring eye protection can include: impact from particles or debris, light or radiation, wind blast, heat, sea spray or impact from some type of ball or puck used in sports.\n\nThis brand of eyewear comes from the Ray-Bans PREDATOR 2 sunglasses series.

ThingDef.label: ballistic goggles (8X10)
ThingDef.description: Eye protection is protective gear for the eyes, and sometimes face, designed to reduce the risk of injury. Examples of risks requiring eye protection can include: impact from particles or debris, light or radiation, wind blast, heat, sea spray or impact from some type of ball or puck used in sports.\n\nThis brand of eyewear comes from the 8X10 ballistic goggle series.

ThingDef.label: eye protection (SI Ballistic M frame)
ThingDef.description: Eye protection is protective gear for the eyes, and sometimes face, designed to reduce the risk of injury. Examples of risks requiring eye protection can include: impact from particles or debris, light or radiation, wind blast, heat, sea spray or impact from some type of ball or puck used in sports.\n\nThis brand of eyewear comes from the Oakley's SI Ballistic M Frame sunglasses series.

ThingDef.Name: TrenchCoatHoodPUBG
ThingDef.label: trench coat hood
ThingDef.description: A detachable hood that originally belongs to a trench coat. Decent for warmth.

ThingDef.Name: BeechfieldBeanie
ThingDef.label: beanie hat
ThingDef.description: A soft, thick cap. Great for keeping warm in winter.\n\nThis variant of beanie is of the Beechfield beanie series.

ThingDef.Name: SkullcapGeneric
ThingDef.label: skull cap
ThingDef.description: A soft, thick cap. Great for keeping warm in winter.\n\nThis variant of beanie is of the Beechfield beanie series.

ThingDef.Name: 511Cap
ThingDef.label: baseball cap
ThingDef.description: A baseball cap is a type of soft cap with a rounded crown and a stiff bill projecting in front. - and it gives anyone who wears it a slight bit of extra charm. It is part of traditional attire.\n\nThis variant of baseball cap is of the 5.11 tactical series.

ThingDef.Name: HelikonTexFieldCap
ThingDef.label: field cap
ThingDef.description: A patrol hat, also known as a field cap, is a soft kepi with a stiff, rounded visor, and flat top, somewhat similar to a baseball cap, worn by the military personnel of some countries in the field when a combat helmet is not required.\n\nThis variant of field cap is of the Helikon-Tex series.

ThingDef.Name: BushmasterBoonie
ThingDef.label: boonie hat
ThingDef.description: A boonie hat or booney hat, is a form of wide-brim hat commonly used by military forces in hot tropical climates. Its design is similar to a bucket hat but with a stiffer brim. The Australian version has a thinner brim giving it the name a "Giggle hat."\n\nThis variant of boonie hat is of the Bushmaster series.

ThingDef.Name: MILTECBoonie
ThingDef.label: jungle hat
ThingDef.description: A boonie hat or booney hat, is a form of wide-brim hat commonly used by military forces in hot tropical climates. Its design is similar to a bucket hat but with a stiffer brim. The Australian version has a thinner brim giving it the name a "Giggle hat."\n\nThis variant of boonie hat is of the Bushmaster series.

ThingDef.Name: FedoraGeneric
ThingDef.label: fedora hat
ThingDef.description: A fedora is a hat with a soft brim and indented crown. It is typically creased lengthwise down the crown and "pinched" near the front on both sides.

ThingDef.Name: GunslingerGeneric
ThingDef.label: gunslinger hat
ThingDef.description: A Stetson is a hat with a supple brim and a dented crown. It's often creased along its length down the crown and "pinched" near the front on both sides. Worn by sharpshooters and lawmen of the Wild West, this iconic headwear adds a touch of rugged style to their attire, embodying the spirit of frontier life.

ThingDef.label: military beret
ThingDef.description: A soft, round, flat-crowned hat.\n\nThis variant is a military issue beret from the Russian armed forces.

ThingDef.label: balaclava (EXF)
ThingDef.description: A balaclava, also known as a balaclava helmet or Bally (UK slang) or ski mask (US slang), is a form of cloth headgear designed to expose only part of the face, usually the eyes and mouth. Depending on style and how it is worn, only the eyes, mouth and nose, or just the front of the face are unprotected.\n\nThis version is the Team Wendy EXF line of balaclavas.

ThingDef.label: pilgrim pants
ThingDef.description: A tougher and heavier set of trekking trousers designed for rough conditions.\n\nThis series of pants are of the Helikon Pilgrim variant.

ThingDef.label: keb pants
ThingDef.description: A tougher and heavier set of trekking trousers designed for rough conditions.\n\nThis series of pants are of the Fjallraven Keb variant.

ThingDef.label: survivor pants
ThingDef.description:
A tougher and heavier set of survival trousers designed for rough conditions.

This series of pants are of the Bear Grylls "Survivor" variant.

Note: Please do not drink your own pee.

ThingDef.label: GORKA 3 pants
ThingDef.description: Part of the GORKA 3 BDU set, designed for cold and rough conditions. Gorka 3 Suit Bars is a Russian special forces military uniform suit designed for mountain divisions (the word "Gorka" originates from Russian word "mountain"). This BDU first appeared in the Soviet army during the Afghanistan war, then widely use during Chechen wars and other conflicts. It is mainly used by special forces (spetsnaz) of MVD, FSB, VDV (airborne), GRU.

ThingDef.label: jeans
ThingDef.description: Jeans are a type of pants or trousers, typically made from denim or dungaree cloth. Often the term "jeans" refers to a particular style of trousers, called "blue jeans", which were invented by Jacob W. Davis in partnership with Levi Strauss & Co. in 1871 and patented by Jacob W. Davis and Levi Strauss on May 20, 1873. Prior to the Levi Strauss patented trousers, the term "blue jeans" had been long in use for various garments (including trousers, overalls, and coats), constructed from blue-colored denim.

ThingDef.label: ACU pants (UCP)
ThingDef.description: A tougher and heavier set of tactical pants designed for rough conditions.\n\nThis variant is an Army Combat Uniform (ACU) pants in Universal Camo Pattern (UCP) camo.

ThingDef.label: BDU pants (D MARPAT)
ThingDef.description: A tougher and heavier set of tactical pants designed for rough conditions.\n\nThis variant is a Battle Dress Uniform (BDU) pants in Desert Marine Pattern (MARPAT) camo.

ThingDef.label: combat trousers (D DPM)
ThingDef.description: A tougher and heavier set of tactical pants designed for rough conditions.\n\nThis variant is a combat trousers in Desert Disruptive Pattern Material (DPM) camo.

ThingDef.label: suit trousers
ThingDef.description: A suit is a set of clothes comprising a suit jacket, or coat, and trousers. When of identical textile, and worn with a collared dress shirt, necktie, and dress shoes, it was traditionally considered informal wear in Western dress codes.

ThingDef.label: P-1944 gas mask
ThingDef.description: A gasmask, also known as a respirator, is a form of headgear designed to cover the face and protect the wearer's respiratory system from being affected by a chemical attack. Depending on style, either the full face is covered, or just the nose and mouth area of the face.\n\nThis version is a commonwealth P1944 gasmask from the great war era.

ThingDef.label: S6 NBC respirator
ThingDef.description: A gasmask, also known as a respirator, is a form of headgear designed to cover the face and protect the wearer's respiratory system from being affected by a chemical attack. Depending on style, either the full face is covered, or just the nose and mouth area of the face.\n\nThis version is an S6 NBC Respirator, the service respirator of British Armed forces during the 1960s-1980s.

ThingDef.label: S10 NBC respirator

ThingDef.label: Blaze wrap scarf
ThingDef.description: The keffiyeh or kufiya also known as shemagh is a traditional Middle Eastern headdress fashioned from a square scarf, usually made of cotton. It is commonly found in arid regions as it provides protection from sunburn, dust and sand.\n\nThis brand of shemagh comes from the 5.11 Blaze series.
A tough trench coat for warmth, while at the same time protecting from grit of the outdoors.

ThingDef.description: A long duster coat for blocking the sun and grit of the outdoors.
ThingDef.label: wasteland coat
field parka
ThingDef.description: A field parka for staying warm in even the coldest of temperatures, tailor made for tough use.

ThingDef.label: vintage parka
ThingDef.description: A vintage parka for staying warm in even the coldest of temperatures, tailor made for tough use.

ThingDef.label: vest jacket
ThingDef.description: A sleeveless jacket to keep warm in even the coldest of temperatures, tailor made for tough use.

ThingDef.label: overcoat
ThingDef.description: An overcoat is a type of long coat intended to be worn as the outermost garment, which usually extends below the knee. Overcoats are most commonly used in winter when warmth is more important. They are sometimes confused with or referred to as topcoats, which are shorter and end at or above the knees. Topcoats and overcoats together are known as outercoats. Unlike overcoats, topcoats are usually made from lighter weight cloth such as gabardine or covert, while overcoats are made from heavier cloth or fur.

ThingDef.label: noir coat
ThingDef.description: A tough trench coat for warmth, while at the same time protecting from grit of the outdoors.

ThingDef.label: suit jacket
ThingDef.description: A suit is a set of clothes comprising a suit jacket, or coat, and trousers. When of identical textile, and worn with a collared dress shirt, necktie, and dress shoes, it was traditionally considered informal wear in Western dress codes.

ThingDef.label: biker jacket
ThingDef.description: A leather jacket is a jacket-length coat that is usually worn on top of other apparel or item of clothing, and made from the tanned hide of various animals. The leather material is typically dyed black, or various shades of brown, but a wide range of colors is possible. Leather jackets can be designed for many purposes, and specific styles have been associated with subcultures such as greasers, motorcyclists and bikers, mobsters, military aviators (especially during and directly after World War II) and music subcultures (punks, goths, metalheads, rivetheads), who have worn the garment for protective or fashionable reasons, and occasionally to create a potentially intimidating appearance.

ThingDef.label: gunslinger jacket
ThingDef.description: A leather coat, donned by gunslingers, outlaws, cowboys, and more during the Gold Rush era, is a tanned hide jacket worn over attire. Crafted from the hides of diverse animals, these coats come in hues like deep black or various shades of brown, with a broad spectrum of colors available. These leather coats are tailored for various purposes and are closely linked to specific subcultures of that era. These subcultures, including frontier adventurers, rebels, and rugged pioneers, embraced these jackets for their protective qualities and rugged style, often using them to exude an air of strength and fearlessness.

ThingDef.label: combat jacket
ThingDef.description: A tough military specification, combat jacket. Worn during a historical conflict by armed forces personnel, these coats typically came in olive and black. Later availability in the civilian market meant more variety for colours.

ThingDef.label: suede jacket
ThingDef.description: A leather jacket is a jacket-length coat that is usually worn on top of other apparel or item of clothing, and made from the tanned hide of various animals. The leather material is typically dyed black, or various shades of brown, but a wide range of colors is possible. Leather jackets can be designed for many purposes, and specific styles have been associated with subcultures such as greasers, motorcyclists and bikers, mobsters, military aviators (especially during and directly after World War II) and music subcultures (punks, goths, metalheads, rivetheads), who have worn the garment for protective or fashionable reasons, and occasionally to create a potentially intimidating appearance.

ThingDef.label: AAC V2 body armour
ThingDef.description: Body armor, also known as body armour, personal armor/armour, or a suit/coat of armour, is protective clothing designed to absorb or deflect physical attacks. Historically used to protect military personnel, today it is used by various types of armed factions (industrial type in particular), security guards or mercenaries, and occasionally ordinary townsfolk.\n\nThis plate carrier variant is the First Spear AAC V2 Multicam body armor, designed for maritime operations.

ThingDef.label: OTV body armour
ThingDef.description: The Interceptor Multi-Threat Body Armor System (IBA) is a bullet-resistant vest that was used by the United States Armed Forces during the 2000s, with some limited usage into the mid-2010s. The IBA and its design replaced the older standardized fragmentation protective Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops (PASGT) body armor system that was designed in the late 1970s and introduced in the early 1980s. The IBA system consists of its core component: the outer tactical vest (OTV), which can optionally be worn with a throat protector, groin protector, and biceps (or deltoid) protector. The latter three auxiliary protectors are removable from the main vest, which can be worn alone.\n\nThis plate carrier variant is the Outer Tactical Vest, used by US Military and originally produced by Point Blank.

ThingDef.label: IOTV gen 2 body armour
ThingDef.description: The Improved Outer Tactical Vest (IOTV) is an enhanced version of, and a replacement for, the older Outer Tactical Vest (OTV) variant of the Interceptor Body Armor, as fielded by the United States Army. The IOTV is compatible with the Deltoid and Auxiliary Protector System (DAPS) components, ESAPI (Enhanced Small Arms Protective Insert), Enhanced Side Ballistic Inserts (ESBI), as well as the OTV's groin protector. It has a flame-resistant stand-alone shirt known as the Army Combat Shirt designed specifically for use with the IOTV, used by US Military and originally produced by Point Blank.

ThingDef.label: MTV body armour
ThingDef.description: The Modular Tactical Vest (MTV or MoTaV) is a ballistic vest originally adopted by the United States Marine Corps in 2006. The MTV was designed as a solution to shortcomings in the decade-old Interceptor Body Armor (IBA) and was selected after a rigorous proposal and examination process by the Marine Corps. The MTV provides better protection levels than the IBA, although it uses the same Small Arms Protective Insert (SAPI) plates.\n\nThis plate carrier variant is the Modular Tactical Vest, used by the USMC and produced by Protective Products International.

It is heavier than most body armours, though it provides a better protection due to it's unique lattice system that resembles a Dragon's scale for it's inner armour plates.

ThingDef.label: PASGT body armour
ThingDef.description: Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops (PASGT, pronounced /pzt/ PAZ-gt) is a combat helmet and ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s, when the helmet and vest were succeeded by the Lightweight Helmet (LWH), Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH), and Interceptor Body Armor (IBA) respectively.

Historically used to protect military personnel, today it is used by various types of armed factions (industrial type in particular), security guards or mercenaries, and occasionally ordinary townsfolk.\n\nThis plate carrier variant is the London Bridge Trading Gen 3 body armor.

ThingDef.label: AR500 Veritas body armour
ThingDef.description: Body armor, also known as body armour, personal armor/armour, or a suit/coat of armour, is protective clothing designed to absorb or deflect physical attacks. Historically used to protect military personnel, today it is used by various types of armed factions (industrial type in particular), security guards or mercenaries, and occasionally ordinary townsfolk.\n\nThis plate carrier variant is the AR500 Veritas.

ThingDef.label: MBC Fantom body armour
ThingDef.description: Body armor, also known as body armour, personal armor/armour, or a suit/coat of armour, is protective clothing designed to absorb or deflect physical attacks. Historically used to protect military personnel, today it is used by various types of armed factions (industrial type in particular), security guards or mercenaries, and occasionally ordinary townsfolk.\n\nThis plate carrier variant is the MBC LLC "Fantom" Plate Carrier, produced by a Russian company.

ThingDef.label: PACA LVC body armour
ThingDef.description: Body armor, also known as body armour, personal armor/armour, or a suit/coat of armour, is protective clothing designed to absorb or deflect physical attacks. Historically used to protect military personnel, today it is used by various types of armed factions (industrial type in particular), security guards or mercenaries, and occasionally ordinary townsfolk.\n\nThis plate carrier variant is the PACA Low Visibility Carrier variant.

ThingDef.label: Bristol body armour
ThingDef.description: Body armor, also known as body armour, personal armor/armour, or a suit/coat of armour, is protective clothing designed to absorb or deflect physical attacks. Historically used to protect military personnel, today it is used by various types of armed factions (industrial type in particular), security guards or mercenaries, and occasionally ordinary townsfolk.\n\nThis plate carrier variant is the Bristol Body Armor variant, known to have been used by British armed forces and the SAS during Operation Nimrod along with the Arktis assault vest worn over.

ThingDef.label: Defender 2 body armour
ThingDef.description: The Defender 2 Body Armor sometimes shortened to D2 is a body armor of Russian origin. The D2 body armor has kevlar inserts as well as two pockets on both the front and back which allow for added ballistic inserts. The soft armour is capable of protection at GOST 2 standards, while the plates in conjunction with the soft armor are capable of the 4 or 5th level. (Unclear, sources contradict) It also has a removable neck protector which is held onto the front with velcro. The vest has some adjustability with its velcro cummerbund. It has been produced in a variety of colors and patterns with some modern versions featuring molle webbing.

ThingDef.label: riot suit
ThingDef.description: Riot armour or riot gear is a part of a body armor set designed to protect the user from blunt force trauma and sharp objects in the event of a violent confrontation. It's a piece of equipment often covering as much parts of the body as possible, specialised in riot control for security or other prison personnel trained to deal with riots.\n\nThis brand of riot suit is from the SecPro line.

ThingDef.label: SecPro riot helmet
ThingDef.description: A riot helmet is part of the riot suit, designed specially to absorb the impact of blunt for trauma and often accompanied by a ballistic face protection to cover the wearer's face in the event of a violent confrontation.\n\nThis brand of riot suit is from the SecPro line.

ThingDef.label: juggernaut helmet
ThingDef.description: Part of the Juggernaut suit, the Juggernaut helmet consists of an Altyn style ballistic helmet fitted with a ballistic face shield and a PBF respirator. This system allows the wearer to be more resistant to chemical attacks and have a great amount of protection for their head.

ThingDef.label: juggernaut suit
ThingDef.description: The Juggernaut suit is a piece of equipment created with the combination of bomb suit parts and plate carriers stacked together in order to add layers and padding of protection for the user. It is given to "Juggernaut" units, hence the name. Often worn while carrying a machinegun, the juggernaut suit is designed to sustain damage and evidently create a walking "tank". It is often found to be highly unwieldy and mobility suffers as a result of the heavy weight this armour has.

ThingDef.label: M1 helmet
ThingDef.description: The M1 helmet is a combat helmet that was used by the U.S. military from World War II until 1985, when it was succeeded by the PASGT helmet. The M1 helmet has become an icon of the US military, with its design inspiring other militaries around the world.

ThingDef.label: ProTec Prime (Pizza Time)
ThingDef.description: Proven protection, proven style. A favorite across every sport, the prime Certified helmet features our classic styling with our durable ABS hard shell and EPS liner for impact protection, compression molded pads and 11 open vents to keep you cool.\n\nThe ProTec Prime helmet is originally a non-ballistic model, however this specific version has been adapted for ballistic use.

ThingDef.label: EXFIL ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: The EXFIL Ballistic features a hybrid composite shell for increased strength and a unique geometry for optimal fit. An innovative, boltless CAM FIT retention quickly adjusts to individual head shapes, providing comfort and stability.\n\nThe EXFIL Ballistic helmet is produced by Team Wendy.

ThingDef.label: F70 HC ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: The 3M Ballistic Helmet F70 (Foxtrot series) is flexible for use in multiple threat environments. The F70 is an integrated and configurable helmet designed for broad use from military combat missions, special forces operations and law enforcement tactical operations.\n\nThe 3M F70 Ballistic helmet is produced by 3M.

ThingDef.label: FLUX ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: The FLUX Ballistic is the cornerstone of the innovative FLUX helmet system. This helmet was specifically designed to give you the highest level of safety, comfort and modularity currently available in a modern ballistic helmet. The lightweight shell is constructed of high performance polyethylene fibers, and features an undercutting geometric profile that follows the natural shape of your head providing exceptional stability and coverage.\n\nThe FLUX Ballistic helmet is produced by MTEK. The word FLUX is an acronym for Future, Lightweight, Undercut, eXpandable and is derived from latin fluxus, meaning "flow".

ThingDef.label: TOR-D ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: TOR-D is the light version of ballistic helmet TOR. Helmet form with special side cutouts provides additional facilities for using active headphones and radio headset. It is intended for individual protection of the soldiers of airborne forces and special divisions from traumas and wounds, and for installing special equipment.Provides the head protection at falling or hitting, under the impact of an explosive wave, small fragments and ricochets, under a hit of pistol bullets and other small-arms bullets spent. Produced by UaRms.

ThingDef.label: SF151 ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: The Ops-Core Future Assault Shell Technology (FAST) Helmet, also known as the FAST helmet, is a combat helmet used by special operations forces and law enforcement organizations. The FAST helmet series is characteristic for its shell shape ear cut geometry which extends critical coverage over the rear occipital bone without load carrier interference, and optimizes weight distribution for increased stability, integration, balance, and improved comfort.\n\nThe SF151 Ballistic helmet is produced by VestGuard, their own version of the FAST helmet. SF stands for "Special Forces".

ThingDef.label: FAST ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: The Ops-Core Future Assault Shell Technology (FAST) Helmet, also known as the FAST helmet, is a combat helmet used by special operations forces and law enforcement organizations. The FAST helmet series is characteristic for its shell shape ear cut geometry which extends critical coverage over the rear occipital bone without load carrier interference, and optimizes weight distribution for increased stability, integration, balance, and improved comfort.\n\nThe FAST LE Ballistic helmet is produced by Ops Core.

ThingDef.label: FAST (SF) ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: The Ops-Core Future Assault Shell Technology (FAST) Helmet, also known as the FAST helmet, is a combat helmet used by special operations forces and law enforcement organizations. The FAST helmet series is characteristic for its shell shape ear cut geometry which extends critical coverage over the rear occipital bone without load carrier interference, and optimizes weight distribution for increased stability, integration, balance, and improved comfort.\n\nThe FAST LE Ballistic helmet is produced by Ops Core, this modified variant is used as a loadout by Special Forces.

ThingDef.label: FAST BUMP ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: The Ops-Core Future Assault Shell Technology (FAST) Helmet, also known as the FAST helmet, is a combat helmet used by special operations forces and law enforcement organizations. The FAST helmet series is characteristic for its shell shape ear cut geometry which extends critical coverage over the rear occipital bone without load carrier interference, and optimizes weight distribution for increased stability, integration, balance, and improved comfort.\n\nThe FAST BUMP helmet is produced by Ops Core, it is originally a non-ballistic model, however this specific version has been adapted for ballistic use.

ThingDef.label: FAST Carbon ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: The Ops-Core Future Assault Shell Technology (FAST) Helmet, also known as the FAST helmet, is a combat helmet used by special operations forces and law enforcement organizations. The FAST helmet series is characteristic for its shell shape ear cut geometry which extends critical coverage over the rear occipital bone without load carrier interference, and optimizes weight distribution for increased stability, integration, balance, and improved comfort.\n\nThe FAST Carbon helmet is produced by Ops Core, it is originally a non-ballistic model, however this specific version has been adapted for ballistic use.

ThingDef.label: MICH TC-2000 helmet (CAG)
ThingDef.description: The Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH) is a U.S. combat helmet and one of several used by the nation's military. It was developed to be the next generation of protective combat helmets for use by the U.S. Army.

ThingDef.label: MICH TC-2000 helmet
ThingDef.description: The Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH) is a U.S. combat helmet and one of several used by the nation's military. It was developed to be the next generation of protective combat helmets for use by the U.S. Army.

ThingDef.label: Mk 6 helmet (D DPM)
ThingDef.description: The Mk 6 helmet is a type of combat helmet that was the standard of the British Armed Forces as well as another supplied helmet of the UN during peacekeeping operations. The Mk 6 replaced the Mk IV helmet (more correctly titled - Helmet Steel MK IV, General Service) in army service and the RAC helmet in naval service. The jump in MK numbers is thought due to the confusion surrounding the MK IV helmet using the MK V lining, introduced in 1959. The MK 6, introduced into service from the 1980s, is designed to accept modern ear protection, Bowman personal radios, and respirators. The helmet is manufactured by NP Aerospace, and is reported to have an "almost unlimited service life" by the manufacturer.\n\nThis version has a Desert Disruptive Pattern Material (DPM) helmet cover.

ThingDef.label: Mk 6 helmet
ThingDef.description: The Mk 6 helmet is a type of combat helmet that was the standard of the British Armed Forces as well as another supplied helmet of the UN during peacekeeping operations. The Mk 6 replaced the Mk IV helmet (more correctly titled - Helmet Steel MK IV, General Service) in army service and the RAC helmet in naval service. The jump in MK numbers is thought due to the confusion surrounding the MK IV helmet using the MK V lining, introduced in 1959. The MK 6, introduced into service from the 1980s, is designed to accept modern ear protection, Bowman personal radios, and respirators. The helmet is manufactured by NP Aerospace, and is reported to have an "almost unlimited service life" by the manufacturer.

ThingDef.label: Mk 6A helmet
ThingDef.description: In 2005, the Mk 6 began to be replaced by an evolution of the original design, the Mk 6A helmet. NP Aerospace also manufactures the Mk 6A. Although it looks very similar to the Mk 6, the Mk 6A has enhanced ballistic protection and is marginally heavier than the earlier model.[7] The two variants can be easily distinguished from each other when the cover is removed, as the material of the Mk 6 is olive green whilst the Mk 6A is black.

ThingDef.label: Mk 7 helmet
ThingDef.description: The Mk 7 helmet was a general issue combat helmet that the British Armed Forces was supplied by NP Aerospace. Officially known as the GS (General Service) Mark 7 combat helmet. It replaced the previous Mk 6A helmet and Mk 6 helmet, introduced in 2005 and 1982 respectively. The Mk 7 helmet was introduced in June 2009 as an UOR (urgent operational requirement). The new helmet offers the same ballistic protection as the Mk6A helmet, but its new shape allows a soldier to lie flat and shoot straight, without the rear rim digging into the body armour and tipping the front rim over their eyes.

ThingDef.label: PAS101 ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops is a combat helmet and ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s, when the helmet and vest were succeeded by the Lightweight Helmet (LWH), Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH), and Interceptor body armor (IBA) respectively. \n\nThe PAS101 Ballistic helmet is produced by VestGuard, their own version of the PASGT helmet, lighter than the original design essentially making it closer to the "LWH" Lightweight Helmet.

ThingDef.label: PAS101 ballistic helmet (navy)
ThingDef.description: Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops is a combat helmet and ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s, when the helmet and vest were succeeded by the Lightweight Helmet (LWH), Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH), and Interceptor body armor (IBA) respectively. \n\nThe PAS101 Ballistic helmet is produced by VestGuard, their own version of the PASGT helmet, lighter than the original design essentially making it closer to the "LWH" Lightweight Helmet.

ThingDef.label: PASGT ballistic helmet
ThingDef.description: Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops is a combat helmet and ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s, when the helmet and vest were succeeded by the Lightweight Helmet (LWH), Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH), and Interceptor body armor (IBA) respectively. \n\nThe PASGT Ballistic helmet is of the original design used by the US Military during the gulf war period.

ThingDef.label: PASGT ballistic helmet (ENVO)
ThingDef.description: Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops is a combat helmet and ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s, when the helmet and vest were succeeded by the Lightweight Helmet (LWH), Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH), and Interceptor body armor (IBA) respectively. \n\nThis PASGT Ballistic helmet is produced by ENVO, their own version of the PASGT helmet is lighter than the original design essentially making it closer to the "LWH" Lightweight Helmet.

ThingDef.label: LWH helmet (D MARPAT)
ThingDef.description: Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops is a combat helmet and ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s, when the helmet and vest were succeeded by the Lightweight Helmet (LWH), Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH), and Interceptor body armor (IBA) respectively. \n\nThe PAS101 Ballistic helmet is produced by VestGuard, their own version of the PASGT helmet, lighter than the original design essentially making it closer to the "LWH" Lightweight Helmet.

ThingDef.label: ACH helmet (UCP)
ThingDef.description: The Advanced Combat Helmet (ACH) is the United States Army's current combat helmet, used since the early 2000s. It was developed by the United States Army Soldier Systems Center,[1] the U.S. Army Special Operations Command,[2] and the U.S. Army Research Laboratory[3] to be the next generation of protective combat helmets for use by the American ground forces. The ACH is derived from the Modular Integrated Communications Helmet.[4] The ACH is currently in the process of being phased out and replaced by the Enhanced Combat Helmet (ECH), an improvement upon the ACH derived from its design. And later being replaced by the Integrated Head Protection System.\n\nThis version is in the Universal Camo Pattern (UCP).

ThingDef.label: LZSH 2DTM helmet
ThingDef.description: During the modern age in Russia, military personnel of the internal troops, as well as police and special forces, required reliable and effective means of protection. At the beginning of 2000, active development of such gear was carried out and in the end LShZ-2DT helmet was introduced, and then its upgraded version "Vulkan" helmet.

ThingDef.label: STSh-81 helmet
ThingDef.description: The Sfera (Russian:) (Sphere), officially called STSh-81, are bullet resistant combat helmets of titanium and steel manufactured with protective GOST rating of 2. They are worn by the Internal Troops of the Interior Ministry in the Soviet Union and its successor state Russia. These helmets continue to be used today by the police and special purpose troops.

ThingDef.label: 6B48 helmet
ThingDef.description: The 6B48 helmet (648) - created for tank crews in the Russian Armed Forces. The 6B46 (646) was issued as part of the Ratnik program. Ratnik (Russian: ; Warrior) is a Russian future infantry combat system. It is designed to improve the connectivity and combat effectiveness of combat personnel in the Russian Armed Forces.

ThingDef.label: Galac-Tac helmet
ThingDef.description: Part of the Galac-Tac body armour set, the Galac-Tac Heavy Gunner helmet is based on the FAST helmet design with mandible and visor add-ons that can be upgraded with ballistic protection for the face. The Galac-Tac armor is a series of modern body armour and helmets that notably have its design loosely based on Mandalorian armour. It was sponsored by the AR500 Body Armor company and have their ballistic technology implemented within the Galac-Tac armour systems.

ThingDef.label: Galac-Tac body armour
ThingDef.description: The Galac-Tac armor is a series of modern body armour and helmets that notably have its design loosely based on Mandalorian armour. It was sponsored by the AR500 Body Armor company and have their ballistic technology implemented within the Galac-Tac armour systems.

ThingDef.label: EOD 9A helmet
ThingDef.description: Part of the EOD 9 bomb suit, designed to cushion the spine (when worn with the bomb suit) and head in case the wearer is knocked over by a blast, has a defogger performance to prevent the helmet visor from clouding, contains thermal heat protection as well as fragmentation and shrapnel damage protection. It is a heavier and cumbersome helmet than most modern ballistic helmets used by infantry forces.

ThingDef.label: EOD 9 bomb suit
ThingDef.description: A bomb suit, Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) suit or a blast suit is a heavy suit of body armor designed to withstand the pressure generated by a bomb and any fragments the bomb may produce. It is usually worn by trained personnel attempting bomb disposal. In contrast to ballistic body armors, which usually focus on protecting the torso and head, a bomb suit must protect all parts of the body, since the dangers posed by a bomb's explosion affect the entire body.\n\nThis bomb suit variant is the EOD 9 suit produced by Med Eng.

ThingDef.label: PASGT body armour (Woodland)
ThingDef.description: PASGT - Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops. A ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s.

ThingDef.label: PASGT body armour (Olive)
ThingDef.description: PASGT - Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops. A ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s.

ThingDef.description: PASGT - Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops. A ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s.

ThingDef.description: PASGT - Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops. A ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s.

ThingDef.description: PASGT - Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops. A ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s.

ThingDef.description: PASGT - Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops. A ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s.

ThingDef.label: PASGT body armour (Arctic)
ThingDef.description: PASGT - Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops. A ballistic vest that was used by the United States military from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s.

ThingDef.label: T.G. Faust Vest
ThingDef.description: T.G. Faust Vest was designed by Thomas G. Faust, the vest was designed to provide enhanced ballistic protection while maintaining mobility for combat personnel.

ThingDef.label: T.G. Faust Vest (Pouches)
ThingDef.description: T.G. Faust Vest was designed by Thomas G. Faust, the vest was designed to provide enhanced ballistic protection while maintaining mobility for combat personnel.

ThingDef.label: RBA Vest (Black)
ThingDef.description: RBA - Ranger Body Armour. It is a US Military issue ballistic vest that was designed for and used chiefly by US ARMY 75th Ranger Regiment operators which also known as the Rangers.

ThingDef.label: RBA Vest (Woodland)
ThingDef.description: RBA - Ranger Body Armour. It is a US Military issue ballistic vest that was designed for and used chiefly by US ARMY 75th Ranger Regiment operators which also known as the Rangers.

ThingDef.label: Aircrew Body Armour
ThingDef.description: The Aircrew vest features a large envelope to accommodate a front torso protector for aircrews, a pocket for maps, and stretchable webbing.

ThingDef.label: M69 Flak Vest
ThingDef.description: The U.S. Army's vests (Body Armor, Fragmentation Protective, Vest M1952a and M69) weighed under eight pounds and were made of 12 layers of ballistic nylon sealed in a vinyl plastic bag to repel water and later revisions added polyethylene stiffeners to alleviate bunching of the ballistic nylon. The exterior of the vest was made of standard nylon fabric.

ThingDef.label: M1 Helmet (Mitchell)
ThingDef.description: The M1 helmet is a combat helmet that was use by the U.S. military from World War II until 1985, when it was succeeded by the PASGT.

ThingDef.label: M1 Helmet (Woodland)
ThingDef.description: The M1 helmet is a combat helmet that was use by the U.S. military from World War II until 1985, when it was succeeded by the PASGT.

ThingDef.description: The M1 helmet is a combat helmet that was use by the U.S. military from World War II until 1985, when it was succeeded by the PASGT.

ThingDef.description: The M1 helmet is a combat helmet that was use by the U.S. military from World War II until 1985, when it was succeeded by the PASGT.

ThingDef.description: The M1 helmet is a combat helmet that was use by the U.S. military from World War II until 1985, when it was succeeded by the PASGT.

ThingDef.label: PASGT Helmet
ThingDef.description: PASGT - Personnel Armour System or Ground Troops. A combat helmet that was used by United State military from the early 1980s until the early or mid-2000s.

ThingDef.label: CVC DH-132A helmet
ThingDef.description: The helmet DH-132 is a ballitic-resistant helmet used by the United State Military armoured vehicle crew.

ThingDef.label: CVC DH-132A helmet (Goggle)
ThingDef.description: The helmet DH-132 is a ballitic-resistant helmet used by the United State Military armoured vehicle crew.

ThingDef.label: HUG-55/P Helmet
ThingDef.description: HUG-55/P is designed for full range of High Ground mission needs. The lightweight standard version is constructed of a Graphite shell which reduces head-borne weight. It was issued to United States Air Force during cold war.

ThingDef.label: Pro-Tec Bump Helmet (Basic)
ThingDef.description: Pro-Tec Bump Helmet is a rugged side-cut helmet used by various special forces as a protective and traning helmet. It was famous as the Delta Force using bump helmet during 90s.

ThingDef.label: Pro-Tec Bump Helmet (Basic - Goggle)
ThingDef.description: Pro-Tec Bump Helmet is a rugged side-cut helmet used by various special forces as a protective and traning helmet. It was famous as the Delta Force using bump helmet during 90s.

ThingDef.label: Patrol Cap (Woodland)

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: sentinel helmet
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: The 5th generation warcasket designed by Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: The 5th generation warcasket of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara, designed and mass-produced as a technical verification platform and a cheap backup solution for the humanoid automatic weapon program.\n\nThe helmet design of the Sentinel is derived from the standard shipbreaker equipment of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara, which has reliable protection against high-speed objects and heat resistance.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: sentinel warcasket
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: The 5th generation warcasket designed by Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: The 5th generation warcasket of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara, designed and mass-produced as a technical verification platform and a cheap backup solution for the humanoid automatic weapon program.\n\nSince the turbulent period of air routes caused by the large-scale use of warcasket by pirates as an armed force, Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara has also become interested in such low-cost humanoid armored combat units, and a series of projects have been established as humanoid automatic weapons project's technical verification, and the Sentinel is the 5th generation warcasket that they put into mass production based on the technology of the humanoid automatic weapon AES-2 BoneMan.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: sentinel shoulders
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: The 5th generation warcasket designed by Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: The 5th generation warcasket of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara, designed and mass-produced as a technical verification platform and a cheap backup solution for the humanoid automatic weapon program.\n\nThe Sentinel's shoulder armor parts are derived from the AES-2S Engineer Model A of the Humanoid Automatic Weapon Project, because its combat loss rate in actual combat is far less than expected, and its parts are reused in a large number of other projects.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: guardian helmet
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: The 5th generation warcasket of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara, has been put into production since the Sentinel was successfully in active service in the security forces.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: The 5th generation warcasket of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara, has been put into production since the Sentinel was successfully in active service in the security forces.\n\nThe Guardian's Helmet is a modification of the Sentinel's Shipbreaker Helmet, with additional full armor installed.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: guardian warcasket
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: The 5th generation warcasket of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara, has been put into production since the Sentinel was successfully in active service in the security forces.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: The 5th generation warcasket of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara,A series of warcasket variants have been used for technical verification and data collection of humanoid automatic weapon projects and sold to all parts of the rimworld.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: guardian shoulders
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: The 5th generation warcasket of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara, has been put into production since the Sentinel was successfully in active service in the security forces.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: The 5th generation warcasket of Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara, has been put into production since the Sentinel was successfully in active service in the security forces.\n\nThe Guardian's pauldrons armor are also derived from the Model A shoulder armor of the AES-2S Engineer project, but the bulletproof armor plate is mounted on the modular interface.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: tyrant helmet
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: An anti-mechanical cluster warcasket designed by Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara based on the purpose of an experimental weapon carrier platform.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: An anti-mechanical cluster warcasket designed by Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara based on the purpose of a weapon carrying experimental platform.\n\The Tyrant's full-coverage helmet is equipped with an experimental electromagnetic jammer, which can effectively interfere electronic equipment from a long distance.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: tyrant warcasket
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: An anti-mechanical cluster warcasket designed by Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara based on the purpose of an experimental weapon carrier platform.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description:
An anti-mechanical cluster warcasket designed by Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara based on the purpose of a weapon carrying experimental platform. 

The Tyrant was originally designed to provide test data support for the project called AES-5S Colossus in the humanoid automatic weapon program. It is equipped with a large number of experimental technologies

But it should be noted that because the experimental nature of the tyrant. its protection is not ideal.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: tyrant shoulders
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: An anti-mechanical cluster warcasket designed by Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara based on the purpose of an experimental weapon carrier platform.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: An anti-mechanical cluster warcasket designed by Interstellar Industries Complex of Nara based on the purpose of a weapon carrying experimental platform. \n\nThe Tyrant's Pauldrons are equipped with a pair of smoke launcher arrays for the bipedal assault mech AES-5A Tauren, which can create a smoke screen to obscure the enemy's view.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: centurion helmet
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: centurion is a modification of the tyrant, which is designed for mechnators.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: The centurion's full-coverage helmet is equipped with an experimental electromagnetic jammer, which can effectively interfere electronic equipment from a long distance. n\n\ also there are pair of antenna which helps the wearer, a mechnator control their mechs.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: centurion warcasket
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: centurion is a modification of the tyrant, which is designed for mechnators.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: The modification model of the tyrant, adding a control pack instead of the rail launcher, also it is designed so the driver can do the regular works as usual.

VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.label: centurion shoulders
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.shortDescription: centurion is a modification of the tyrant, which is designed for mechnators.
VFEPirates.WarcasketDef.description: The centurion's pauldrons armor are derived from the Model A shoulder armor with a pair of plate antenna.
